document_name: Final Report - Integrated Land Development in the South.pdf
http://www.undp.org/content/dam/undp/documents/projects/PAL/00047798/Final Report - Integrated Land Development in the South.pdf

outputs.output_descr:
The Italian Government through the Italian Cooperation Directorate of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs signed on 28/2/2002 a trust fund agreement with UNDP/PAPP to contribute a grant of Euro 2,199,474.16 for financing the "Integrated Rural Development Project in the Hebron and Bethlehem Districts". The closing date of this agreement was extended on 21/3/2007 from 31/12/2004 to 31/12/2009 through an amendment to the agreement between the Consulate General of Italy in Jerusalem and UNDP/PAPP. 
The Goal of the Italian Contribution is to generate employment, reduce poverty and improve the social and living conditions of the target rural population in the southern area of the West Bank. The Specific objectives include the following: 
•	Rapid increase in the production capacity of basic food elements 
•	Expand agricultural land through land development 
•	Increase incomes of targeted groups 
•	Generate short-term employment opportunities through labor intensive civil works 
•	Increase access to agricultural water resources 

The main expected outputs over the two years life of the project include, but not limited to, the following:
•	2,000 Dunums of land reclaimed and cultivated 
•	120,000 of fruit trees planted 
•	At least 50 kms of agricultural roads rehabilitated and constructed 
•	At least 100 water harvesting cisterns constructed 
•	Approximately 70,000 working days generated for the benefit of 1,000 families.

project_descr: Integrated Rural Development Project in Hebron and Bethlehem Districts
